intro: Syncalathium qinghaiense, commonly known as the Qinghai syncalathium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Qinghai region of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
